data.name: Cfg_allowUserEnteredHtml_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether users are allowed to enter limited HTML in titles, captions and external media assets (for example, embed code for a YouTube video). The list of valid HTML tags and attributes is defined below. When checked, any HTML that is not approved is automatically removed when the user attempts to enter it. For external media assets, the user is alerted to the invalid tags and the asset is not added.

When unchecked, HTML is not accepted in any user-editable field. This is the most secure and reliable way to prevent malicious attacks such as cross-site scripting.

Unchecking this option does not remove HTML from existing assets. However, new and changed album and media asset titles and captions will be stripped of HTML when they are saved.

NOTE: Site and gallery administrators are always allowed to enter any HTML and JavaScript they choose, regardless of this setting.

data.name: Cfg_emailFromAddress_Bdy
data.value: E-mails sent from Gallery Server (error reports and password change notifications) will appear to be sent from this e-mail address.

data.name: Cfg_emailFromName_Bdy
data.value: E-mails sent from Gallery Server (error reports and password change notifications) will appear to be sent from this person.

data.name: Cfg_pageHeaderTextUrl_Bdy
data.value:
The URL the user will be directed to when she clicks the gallery's title text. It is optional: if not present, no link will be rendered.

This setting can be overridden on the Gallery Control Settings page.

Examples:

  • http://www.mysite.com
  • / (the root of the web site)
  • ~/ (the top level album)

data.name: Cfg_pageHeaderText_Bdy
data.value:
The header text that appears at the top of every page.

This setting can be overridden on the Gallery Control Settings page.

data.name: Cfg_sendEmailOnError_Bdy
data.value: When checked, the users listed below are sent a detailed report when a web site error occurs. The e-mail settings must be configured, including specifying an SMTP server, for this option to work.

data.name: Cfg_smtpPort_Bdy
data.value:
Specify the port number to use when sending SMTP mail. This setting is useful when the web server is behind a proxy.

If you leave it blank, Gallery Server will use the SMTP port specified in the system.net mailSettings section of web.config.

If not specified, and no value is defined (or inherited) in web.config, the default port 25 is used.

data.name: Cfg_smtpServer_Bdy
data.value:
Specify the IP address or name of the SMTP server used to send e-mails (e.g. 127.0.0.1, Godzilla, mail.yourisp.com).

If you leave it blank, Gallery Server will use the SMTP server specified in the system.net mailSettings section of web.config.

If not specified, and no value is defined (or inherited) in web.config, Gallery Server will attempt to use the local server.

data.name: Cfg_defaultAlbumThumbnailBackgroundColor_Bdy
data.value: The background color of the thumbnail image. It can be specified as hex (e.g. #336699), RGB (e.g. 127,55,95), or one of the System.Color.KnownColor enum values (e.g. Maroon).

data.name: Cfg_defaultAlbumThumbnailFontColor_Bdy
data.value: The color of the text. It can be specified as hex (e.g. #336699), RGB (e.g. 127,55,95), or one of the System.Color.KnownColor enum values (e.g. Maroon).

data.name: Cfg_defaultAlbumThumbnailFontName_Bdy
data.value: The font in which the text on a thumbnail is displayed. The font must be installed on the web server. If the font is not installed, a generic sans serif font will be substituted.

data.name: Cfg_defaultAlbumThumbnailFontSize_Bdy
data.value: The size, in pixels, of the font used to display the text. Valid values: 6 - 100.

data.name: Cfg_defaultAlbumThumbnailText_Bdy
data.value: The text to appear on a thumbnail image.

data.name: Cfg_defaultAlbumThumbnailWidthToHeightRatio_Bdy
data.value:
The ratio of the width to height of the thumbnail image. The length of the longest side of the image is set by the MaxThumbnailLength property, and the length of the remaining side is calculated using this ratio.

A ratio of more than 1.00 results in the width being greater than the height (landscape), while a ratio less than 1.00 results in the width being less than the height (portrait).

Example: If MaxThumbnailLength = 115 and the aspect ratio = 1.50, the width of the default thumbnail image is 115 and the height is 77 (115/1.50).

data.name: Cfg_maxAlbumThumbnailTitleDisplayLength_Bdy
data.value: The maximum number of characters to display when showing the title of an album or media asset in thumbnail view.

data.name: Cfg_maxAlbumThumbnailTitleDisplayLength_Hdr
data.value: Title thumbnail - max number of characters

data.name: Cfg_mediaObjectPath_Bdy
data.value:
The path to a directory containing the media assets. The path may be:

  • Relative to the root of the web application (e.g. \gs\mediaobjects)
  • A full path to a local resource (e.g. C:\mymedia)
  • A UNC path to a local or network resource (e.g. \\mynas\media)

The initial and trailing slashes are optional.

Mapped drives present a security risk and are not supported.

Note: Changing the location does not move assets to the new location. If you change this setting, you should synchronize the database (from Actions menu, choose synchronize) so that the records match the files in the directory. An alternative to synchronizing is to use a tool such as File Explorer to manually copy the files from the old location to the new location.

data.name: Cfg_mediaObjectTransitionDuration_Bdy
data.value: The duration of the transition effect, in seconds, when navigating between media assets. This setting has no effect when the media asset transition effect is set to None.

data.name: Cfg_mediaObjectTransitionType_Bdy
data.value: Specifies the visual transition effect to use when browsing from one media asset to the next.

data.name: Cfg_optimizedPath_Bdy
data.value:
The path to a directory where Gallery Server should store the web-optimized versions of media assets. If no path is specified, the directory containing the original media asset is used to store the file.

You can use the same directory as your original media asset files or a different one. Many users prefer to store the thumbnail and web-optimized files in a separate directory to keep the directories containing the original files clean.

The path may be:

  • Relative to the root of the web application (e.g. \gs\mediaobjects)
  • A full path to a local resource (e.g. C:\mymedia)
  • A UNC path to a local or network resource (e.g. \\mynas\media)

The initial and trailing slashes are optional.

Mapped drives present a security risk and are not supported.

Note: Changing the location does not move assets to the new location. If you change this setting, you should synchronize the database (from actions menu, choose synchronize) to generate new files in the new location. An alternative to synchronizing is to use a tool such as File Explorer to manually copy the files from the old location to the new location.

data.name: Cfg_thumbnailPath_Bdy
data.value:
The path to a directory where Gallery Server should store the thumbnail images of media assets. If no path is specified, the directory containing the original media asset is used to store the thumbnail image.

You can use the same directory as your original media asset files or a different one. Many users prefer to store the thumbnail and compressed images in a separate directory to keep the directories containing the original files clean.

The path may be:

  • Relative to the root of the web application (e.g. \gs\mediaobjects)
  • A full path to a local resource (e.g. C:\mymedia)
  • A UNC path to a local or network resource (e.g. \\mynas\media)

The initial and trailing slashes are optional.

Mapped drives present a security risk and are not supported.

Note: Changing the location does not move assets to the new location. If you change this setting, you should synchronize the database (from actions menu, choose synchronize) to generate new thumbnails in the new location. An alternative to synchronizing is to use a tool such as File Explorer to manually copy the files from the old location to the new location.

data.name: Admin_Images_About_Compressed_Images_Bdy
data.value:
When you add an image or synchronize the database, Gallery Server creates a compressed version of an image (in JPG format) when at least one of these is true:

  • The file size of the image is larger than a designated value (called the compression limit)
  • The length of the image's longest side is larger than a designated length (called the compressed image length)

Example: You upload a 1656 px by 1242 px JPG image that is 800 KB. You have Gallery Server configured with these settings:

  • The compression limit is 50 KB.
  • The compression quality setting is 70.
  • The compressed image length is 640 px.

Since the image is larger than the 50 KB limit, a compressed copy of the original is created with a quality setting of 70 and the dimensions 640 px by 480 px.

NOTE: In this example, even if the original image is less than 50 KB, a compressed image is still created, because the length of its longest side (1656 px) is longer than the compressed image length setting (640 px).

data.name: Cfg_applyWatermarkToThumbnails_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether to apply the text and/or image watermark to thumbnail images. This property is ignored if watermarking is disabled.

data.name: Cfg_applyWatermark_Bdy
data.value:
Applies a watermark to compressed and original images. If checked, both the text and the image specified below are applied to images.

Note: If a user belongs to a role with "View images without watermarks" permission, then no watermarks are applied to images for this user, regardless of this setting.

data.name: Cfg_autoStartMediaObject_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether a video, audio or other dynamic media asset will automatically start playing in the user's browser. This setting is ignored if the browser plug-in does not support this feature.

data.name: Cfg_maxOptimizedLength_Bdy
data.value:
The length (in pixels) of the longest edge of the compressed image that Gallery Server creates when an image is added. The length of the shorter side is calculated automatically based on the aspect ratio of the image.

This value is also used to determine if a compressed version of an image needs to be created. If you add an image and the length of its longest side is greater than this value, a compressed version is created.

data.name: Cfg_optimizedImageJpegQuality_Bdy
data.value: The quality level that compressed JPG images are created with. Valid values are 1 - 100, with 1 being the worst quality (smallest file size) and 100 being the best quality (largest file size).

data.name: Cfg_optimizedImageTriggerSizeKB_Bdy
data.value:
When an image's file size is above this value, a bandwidth-friendly, compressed version is created. If an image's file size is smaller than this value, no compressed version is created.

The original image is never altered or deleted, regardless of this setting. (Rotating and image metadata writing are the only functions that modify the original image.)

This setting is applied: (a) when new images are added to the gallery and (b) during synchronization if the Overwrite existing compressed images option is selected.

data.name: Cfg_originalImageJpegQuality_Bdy
data.value: The quality level at which original JPG images are saved. This setting is only used when the original is modified by the user, such as rotation and persisting metadata. Valid values are 1 - 100, with 1 being the worst quality (smallest file size) and 100 being the best quality (largest file size).

data.name: Cfg_watermarkImageLocation_Bdy
data.value: Specifies the location for the watermark image on the recipient image.

data.name: Cfg_watermarkImageOpacityPercent_Bdy
data.value: The opacity of the watermark image. Valid values are 0 - 100, 0 being completely transparent and 100 completely opaque.

data.name: Cfg_watermarkImagePath_Bdy
data.value: Specifies the watermark image to be applied to the recipient image. Must be JPG, JPEG, GIF, BMP, TIF, TIFF or PNG.

data.name: Cfg_watermarkImageWidthPercent_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies the percent of the overall width of the recipient image that should be covered with the watermark image. The size of the image is automatically scaled to achieve the desired width. Valid values are 0 - 100.

For example, a value of 50 means the watermark image is 50% as wide as the recipient image.

A value of 0 turns off this feature and causes the image to be rendered at its actual size.

data.name: Cfg_watermarkTextColor_Bdy
data.value: The color of the watermark text. It can be specified as hex (e.g. #336699), RGB (e.g. 127,55,95), or one of the System.Color.KnownColor enum values (e.g. Maroon).

data.name: Cfg_watermarkTextFontName_Bdy
data.value: The font used for the watermark text. If the font is not installed on the web server, a generic sans serif font will be substituted.

data.name: Cfg_watermarkTextFontSize_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies the height, in pixels, of the watermark text. Valid values are 1 - 10000.

Note: This value is ignored if the watermark text width percentage is non-zero.

data.name: Cfg_watermarkTextLocation_Bdy
data.value: Specifies the location for the watermark text on the recipient image.

data.name: Cfg_watermarkTextOpacityPercent_Bdy
data.value: The opacity of the watermark text. This is a value from 0 to 100, with 0 being invisible and 100 being solid, with no transparency.

data.name: Cfg_watermarkTextWidthPercent_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies the percent of the overall width of the recipient image that should be covered with the watermark text. The size of the text is automatically scaled up or down to achieve the desired width. Valid values are 0 - 100.

This setting overrides the watermark font size setting. To disable this setting so that the watermark font size is enabled, set this value to zero.

For example, a value of 50 means the text is 50% as wide as the recipient image.

The text is never rendered in a font smaller than 4 pixels, so in cases of long text it may stretch wider than the percentage specified in this setting.

data.name: Cfg_watermarkText_Bdy
data.value: Specifies the text to apply to images in the gallery. The text is applied in a single line. Leave this setting blank if no text watermark is desired.

data.name: Cfg_maxThumbnailLength_Bdy
data.value:
The length (in pixels) of the longest edge of the thumbnail image that Gallery Server creates when an image is added. The length of the shorter side is calculated automatically based on the aspect ratio of the image.

After changing this value, regenerate new thumbnail images by running the synchronize function, making sure to select the option Overwrite existing thumbnail images.

data.name: Task_Synch_IncludeChildAlbums_Hlp_Bdy
data.value:
When checked, Gallery Server will recursively synchronize any child albums in addition to synchronizing the current album. Leave unchecked if you only want to synchronize the current album, not any child albums.

If the current album does not contain any child albums, this setting has no effect.

data.name: Task_Synch_OverwriteCompressed_Hlp_Bdy
data.value:
When checked, new web-optimized files are created for each media asset.

If unchecked, a web-optimized version is created only if it does not exist.

This setting applies only to those media files where it is possible to create a web-optimized version, such as most image types and video or audio files when the Gallery Server Binary Pack is installed and an applicable encoder setting is specified.

Synchronizing the database will run slightly faster if you leave this option unchecked.

data.name: Task_Synch_OverwriteThumbnails_Hlp_Bdy
data.value:
When checked, new thumbnail images are created for each media asset, overwriting any existing thumbnails.

If unchecked, a thumbnail is created only if it does not exist.

Synchronizing the database will run slightly faster if you leave this option unchecked.

data.name: Task_Synch_Progress_Skipped_Objects_Msg2
data.value: An administrator can enable or disable file types on the File Types page.

data.name: Task_Synch_Progress_Skipped_Objects_Msg1
data.value: Note: {{:SkippedFiles.length}} files and/or directories were not added to the gallery.
data.comment: <2013.06.01> Describes the number of files/directories skipped during a sync. The {{:SkippedFiles.length}} value is jsRender syntax and will be replaced during client side template rendering with the actual number of skipped files.

data.name: Task_Synch_Progress_SynchRate_Units
data.comment: <2016.10.12> This is the text displayed in the sync popup window that is appended to the calculated value of the synchronization rate. Ex: 8.2 assets/sec

data.name: Task_Synch_Options_Hlp_Bdy
data.value:
Each album in Gallery Server has a corresponding physical directory on the web server's hard drive. The synchronization procedure updates the Gallery Server data store with information about the media assets in this directory.

Only those files with file extensions that are enabled are included in the gallery. You can edit this list on the File Types page.

When should you synchronize? You might want to synchronize when:

  • You just installed Gallery Server and you want to load the data store with media assets without using the Add media command. Make sure your media files are copied into the media assets directory before synchronizing. This directory is specified in the Media Settings page.
  • You added, moved, copied, or deleted assets using File Explorer instead of the Gallery Server interface, causing the database to become out of sync with the media files.
  • You used a third party program like PhotoShop to alter one or more media files, and you want Gallery Server to recreate the thumbnail and compressed image files.
  • You changed a configuration setting and want Gallery Server to process all media assets with the new setting. For example, you may have changed the compressed image size, enabled or disabled a file extension, or moved the thumbnail storage directory to a new location.
  • A bug in Gallery Server has caused the database to become out of sync with the object files on the web server's hard drive.

data.name: Task_Add_Objects_ZipOption_Bdy
data.value:
Normally, the contents of a ZIP file are extracted and the original ZIP file is discarded. Check this option to treat ZIP files as a media asset and allow them to be viewed and downloaded. When checked, the ZIP file is added to the gallery and the contents of the ZIP file are ignored.

This option is disabled if the ZIP file extension is disabled in the File Types page.

data.name: Task_Add_Objects_ZipOption_Hdr
data.value: Treat ZIP files as media assets

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_Cannot_Delete_Role_Msg

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_Cannot_Remove_Admin_Perm_Msg

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Cannot_Delete_User_Msg

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Cannot_Revoke_Approval_Msg
data.value: Cannot revoke approval. You are editing the user account you are logged on as, and are trying to revoke approval, which would disable this account. You must log on as another user to revoke approval for this account.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Cannot_Save_User_Msg

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Locked_User_Dtl

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Pwd_Rest_Disabled_Msg

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Pwd_Retrieval_Disabled_Msg

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Question_Answer_Enabled_Msg
data.value: Cannot change or reset password. Gallery Server has been configured to require an answer to a pre-determined question when changing or resetting the password, but this web page does not provide question/answer functionality. As a result, you cannot change the password unless you are logged on as this user. Set requiresQuestionAndAnswer="false" in web.config to allow administrators to change passwords.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Create_User_Error_DuplicateEmail

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Create_User_Error_DuplicateUserName

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Create_User_Error_InvalidAnswer

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Create_User_Error_InvalidQuestion

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Create_User_Error_ProviderError
data.value: The authentication provider returned an error. Please verify your entry and try again. If the problem persists, please contact your system administrator.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Create_User_Error_UserRejected
data.value: The user creation request has been canceled. Please verify your entry and try again. If the problem persists, please contact your system administrator.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_AddAlbum_Bdy
data.value:
This permission allows a user to add an album. Note: When moving or copying an album, users must have this permission on the destination album.

When a user moves or copies an album, any media assets within the album are also transferred regardless of whether the user has Add media asset permission on the destination album.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_AddMediaObject_Bdy
data.value:
This permission gives a user the ability to add media assets such as images, videos, audio files, and documents. Only those media assets that are enabled on the Media Object Types page can be added.

Note: A user must have both Add media asset permission and Add album permission in order to add a ZIP file that contains one or more directories, since Gallery Server attempts to convert the directories to albums.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_AdminSite_Bdy
data.value: This permission provides unrestricted access to all functionality in Gallery Server. This permission applies to all galleries and albums and cannot be selectively applied to individual albums.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_DeleteChildAlbum_Bdy
data.value:
This permission allows the deletion of a child album, but not the top level album this permission is applied to.

If the deleted album contains media assets, they are also deleted, even if the user does not have Delete media asset permission.

Note: When moving an album, users must have this permission on the source album, as moving can be thought of as deleting an album from one location and adding it to another. (The user must also have permission to add an album to the destination album.)

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_DeleteMediaObject_Bdy
data.value:
This permission allows the deletion of a media asset.

Note: When moving a media asset, users must have this permission on the source album, as moving can be thought of as deleting an object from one location and adding it to another. (The user must also have permission to add a media asset to the destination album.)

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_EditAlbum_Bdy
data.value: This permission allows a user to edit album information, such as the title, caption, tags, the assigned thumbnail, and the order of media assets and child albums.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_EditMediaObject_Bdy
data.value: This permission allows a user to edit a media asset's title, caption, tags, and other properties. For images, it also allows rotation and the deletion of the original, high resolution image (if it exists).

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_HideWatermark_Bdy
data.value: This permission causes images to be shown to the user without the watermark applied. If a user belongs to more than one role with conflicting values, then watermarks are not shown. This permission is ignored if the watermark functionality is disabled for the gallery.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_Overview_Bdy
data.value:
Security in Gallery Server consists of creating roles with the desired permissions applied to specific albums. Users are then assigned to one or more of these roles.

The default System Administrator role provides administrative privileges to all galleries. You can create additional roles with specific permissions that target individual albums.

When a role is applied to an album, it is automatically applied to all child albums. When an album is added, moved, or copied to a new location, it inherits any role permissions from the containing album.

Gallery Server will give a user permission to perform an activity if any of the user's roles contain the requested permission, even if the others do not. For example, say a user belongs to three roles. Two of the roles do not have Delete album permission but the third one does. In this case, the user is given permission to delete the album that is specified in the role with the Delete album permission.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_Synchronize_Bdy
data.value:
This permission provides the ability to synchronize the media asset files on the web server's hard drive with the records in the data store.

Note: If a user has the ability to edit the media assets directory outside the security boundary of Gallery Server (such as using a utility like File Explorer), and the user also has Synchronize permission here, he or she effectively has the ability to add and delete albums and media assets, even if those permissions are not included in a user's role.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_ViewHiResImage_Bdy
data.value:
This permission provides read only access to the original version of media files, if they exist.

For example, when a user uploads a large photo, a web-optimized version is created. Access to the web-optimized version is controlled through the View albums/assets permission, and access to the high-resolution original is controlled through this permission.

Similarly, when the Binary Pack is used to create web-optimized versions of video and audio files, the View albums/assets permission controls access to the web-optimized version, and the original video is protected by this permission.

Note that when web-optimized versions do not exist (e.g. for documents, small images, or for video and audio when the Binary Pack is not installed), this permission is ignored.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_ViewObject_Bdy
data.value: This permission provides a read only view of photos, videos, and other media assets. Note that when web-optimized versions of media assets exist, this permission applies to them and not the original media file. Use the permission View original media source to control access to the original file.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Overview_Bdy
data.value:
User accounts are used to control access to albums and gallery management functions. By default, Gallery Server allows anonymous browsing of all albums but requires that users log in to create albums, add media assets, and perform administrative tasks.

Note: You can disable anonymous browsing on the User Settings page.

Users are assigned to one or more roles. Use the manage roles page to configure the roles with the desired permission. Then use this page to assign each user to the appropriate role(s).

A user has permission to perform an activity if any of the user's roles contain the requested permission, even if the others do not. For example, say a user belongs to three roles. Two of the roles do not have Delete album permission but the third one does. In this case, the user is given permission to delete the album that is specified in the role with the Delete album permission.

data.name: Admin_MimeTypes_Overview_Bdy
data.value:
Use this page to manage the types of files Gallery Server manages. By default only files with a .jpg or .jpeg file extension are allowed.

A checkbox indicates that the file type is allowed in the gallery, typically by users uploading them or by a user running the synchronization task.

If you disable a file type that has existing media assets in the gallery, those assets will be removed from the gallery during the next synchronization (the files will not be deleted, however).

The MIME type (e.g. image/jpg) is used to determine how the file is rendered in the browser. See the Media Templates page for more information.

NOTE: Enabling/disabling a file type applies only to the current gallery, but adding, deleting, and changing the MIME type applies to all galleries.

data.name: Task_Add_Objects_External_Object_Overview_Bdy
data.value:
You can add items to your gallery that are hosted on the internet or can be represented with HTML. Here are some examples:

  • YouTube videos
  • Videos hosted at silverlight.live.com
  • HTML that links to an image
  • Entire HTML files linked from an iframe

data.name: Task_Add_Objects_External_Object_Type_Bdy
data.value: Select whether you are linking to a video, audio, image, or other type of object. Gallery Server uses this setting to create an appropriate thumbnail image.

data.name: Task_Add_Objects_Local_Media_Overview_Bdy
data.value:
You can upload one or more files to the current album. The file must be a type that is enabled for the gallery, and the file size must be less than {0:N0} MB.

If you specify a ZIP file, its contents are extracted and imported into the gallery. If the ZIP file contains directories, they are converted to albums. For example, you may upload a single zip file containing several directories and hundreds of media assets.

You can prevent automatic ZIP file extraction by selecting the checkbox on this web page labeled "Treat ZIP files as media assets and do not extract contents".

data.name: Task_Add_Objects_Local_Media_Overview_Hdr
data.value: Add media files to your gallery

data.name: Task_Add_Objects_All_Adding_Types_Disabled_Msg
data.value: The administrator has disabled the ability to add both local and external media assets. This setting is managed on the Media Settings page.

data.name: Admin_MediaObjects_AllowAddExternalContent_Label
data.value: Allow adding links to external content (such as YouTube videos)

data.name: Cfg_AllowAddExternalContent_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether users can add a link to external content, such as a YouTube video. Unchecking this setting causes the External Content tab on the Add media web page to be hidden.

Users must also be authenticated and a member of a role with AllowAddMediaObject or AllowAdministerSite permission in order to add external links.

If this setting is disabled, and the Upload media files setting is also disabled, the only way to add media assets is through synchronizing.

data.name: Cfg_AllowAddLocalContent_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether users are allowed to upload media files, such as photos, audio, and video. Unchecking this setting causes the Files tab on the Add media web page to be hidden.

Users must also be authenticated and a member of a role with AllowAddMediaObject or AllowAdministerSite permission in order to upload files.

If this setting is disabled, and the Link to external content setting is also disabled, the only way to add media assets is through synchronizing.

data.name: Cfg_MaxUploadSize_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates the maximum size, in kilobytes, of the files that can be uploaded using the Add media commmand. Use this setting to keep users from uploading very large files and to help guard against Denial of Service (DOS) attacks. A value of zero (0) indicates there is no restriction on upload size (unlimited).

This value applies to the content length of the entire upload request, not just the file. For example, if this value is 1024 KB and the user attempts to upload two 800 KB images, the request will fail because the total content length is larger than 1024 KB. This setting is not used during synchronization.

data.name: Admin_BackupRestore_Backup_Overview_Bdy
data.value:
Use this tool to create an XML backup file containing the gallery data in your database. This file may be used to transfer your data to another server, restore a gallery after a failure, or convert your data storage to another provider (for example, from SQL CE to SQL Server).

Note: The backup/restore functionality works ONLY with data stored in the database having a connection string named GalleryDb. This name is specified in web.config.

For example, if you are storing gallery data in one SQL Server database and the membership data in another, your backup file will only contain the gallery data, even if you selected the Export user accounts option on this page.

data.name: Admin_BackupRestore_ExportGalleryData_Bdy
data.value:
Select this option to include gallery data, such as titles, captions, and metadata in the backup file.

Note: Selecting this option DOES NOT back up media asset files. To back these up, use a utility like File Explorer to copy them from your media assets directory.

data.name: Admin_BackupRestore_ExportGalleryData_Hdr
data.value: Export media asset and album data

data.name: Admin_BackupRestore_ExportUserAccounts_Bdy
data.value:
Select this option to include the ASP.NET membership data in the backup file. This includes the users, roles, and applications stored in the membership tables (the tables whose names start with "aspnet_").

When selected, ALL membership data is exported. If you using these tables to manage membership for other applications, be aware that the data for these other applications are also included in the backup file.

Note: The file does not contain your media asset files. To back these up, use a utility like File Explorer to copy them from your media assets directory.

SECURITY NOTE: If the membership provider is configured to store passwords in clear text (which is the default), the backup file will also include these passwords. Use care when moving and storing this file to prevent unauthorized access.

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Settings_ShowErrorDetails_Label
data.value: Display detailed error message when an exception occurs (WARNING: May reveal private data)

data.name: Cfg_enableExceptionHandler_Bdy
data.value: Select this option to use Gallery Server's own error handling routine to deal with all unexpected errors. Disable this option if you have an application-level error handler defined in web.config or global.asax that you want to use for unhandled exceptions. Errors are always logged in the error log, even if this setting is disabled.

data.name: Cfg_showErrorDetails_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether to display the full details of an unhandled exception that occurs within the gallery. This can reveal sensitive information to the user, so it should only be used for debugging purposes. When unchecked, a generic error message is displayed. This setting has no effect if Error Handling is disabled. Full details are always stored in the error log, so it is recommended to disable this option and refer to the error log for more information.

NOTE: When Error Handling is enabled and the web.config file has debugging enabled (debug='true'), error details are displayed, even when this setting is disabled.

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Settings_ShowLogin_Label
data.value: Show user account buttons on every page

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Settings_ShowSearch_Label
data.value: Show search button on every page

data.name: Cfg_showLogin_Bdy
data.value:
When checked, controls related to user account management are shown in the top right corner of every page. These include the user name, login/logout button, and the link to the user's account page (if the option to allow users to manage their own accounts is enabled on the User Settings page). You may want to disable this feature when the audience is primarily anonymous web users without user accounts.

Administrators can always log in by navigating directly to the login page (use the query string g=login; ex: default.aspx?g=login).

This setting can be overridden on the Gallery Control Settings page.

data.name: Cfg_showSearch_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether to display the search link in the top right corner of every page.

This setting can be overridden on the Gallery Control Settings page.

Or you can enable the option on the Gallery Settings page to show detailed information when an error occurs. If that screen is unavailable because of this error, you can also see error details by temporarily setting debug="true" in web.config.

data.value: Upload the file to the server and validate

data.name: Error_Cannot_Write_To_Directory_Hint_Dtl
data.value:
• The directory does not exist or the IIS application pool identity does not have read, write and modify permission to it.
  • Did you move your gallery? If you moved your gallery to a server that can't see one of the media assets paths (original, thumbnail or optimized), you will get this error.
  • To resolve both of the above issues, try the following: (1) Create the path manually using a tool like File Explorer, an FTP program, or your web host control panel (2) Adjust permissions using File Explorer or your web host control panel so the IIS application pool identity has modify rights to the location (3) Change the IIS application pool identity to an account with modify rights to the location. If accessing a path on another server, you may need to specify a domain account rather than a local account. (4) Edit the database setting to point to a new location (see below).
  • Is the application running at less than Full Trust? In this case, ASP.NET prevents writing to any folder outside the web application. Update the path to point to a location within the web app (see below).
  • Don't want to give the gallery write permission to your media files? No problem - You can configure your gallery to have read-only access to your media assets. For example, you may want to expose your media collection on your web site but you want to guarantee that nothing, not even the web site code, can modify your original files. Read more about this feature in the Administrator's Guide. If this error is preventing you from getting to the site admin area to enable this setting, you can manually change the setting by updating the MediaObjectPathIsReadOnly setting in the GallerySetting table in the database.
  • If you can't get to the site admin area to change the media path location, you can do it manually in the database. Open the GallerySetting table and look for rows where the column SettingName matches these values: MediaObjectPath, ThumbnailPath, OptimizedPath. Edit the values to point to a valid location. Note that there will be at least two records for each setting - one will be for the template gallery and should not be updated (the template gallery usually has FKGalleryId=1).

data.name: Msg_CannotEditGalleryIsReadOnly_Dtl
data.value: The gallery is read only, so you are not allowed to perform any operation that modifies the media files.

data.value: This album is hidden from anonymous users

data.name: UC_Album_Not_Private_Tt
data.value: This album is visible to anonymous users

data.name: UC_Album_Anon_Disabled_Msg
data.value: Anonymous access is disabled for the entire gallery. Enable it on the User Settings page.

data.name: UC_Album_Visibility_Changed_Dtl
data.value:
By default, an anonymous user (one that is not logged in) can view all albums. You can hide some or all albums from these users with this setting. When an album is private, anonymous users cannot see the album or discover it through a search. It's as if it doesn't exist. When users log on, the normal security roles take over and the privacy setting is ignored.

Marking an album private automatically causes all of its child albums to be private. Albums below a private album cannot be made public.

TIP: If you want to require users to log on to see albums in the gallery, a better approach is to disable anonymous browsing on the User Settings page.

data.name: UC_Album_Owner_Removed
data.value: {0} is no longer the album owner.

data.name: UC_Album_Owner_Changed_Dtl
data.value: {0} is now the owner of this album.

data.name: UC_Album_Owner_Tt_Dtl
data.value:
An album owner can add, edit, and delete items in the album, including child albums. Only one user can be specified as an owner of an album, but albums can inherit owners from parent albums.

The permissions given to owners are defined in a role whose name begins with "_Album Owner Template" and can be changed using the Manage Roles page.

TIP: Read more about this feature in the Administrator's Guide.

data.name: Cfg_allowAnonymousBrowsing_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether users can browse the gallery without logging in. When unchecked, users must log in with a valid account to view media assets.

This setting can be overridden on the Gallery Control Settings page.

data.name: Cfg_allowAnonMoDownload_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether users can access the original media files without logging in. When unchecked, users can access the original file only by logging in with a valid account, and that account must belong to a role having View original media source permission.

This setting is ignored when anonymous browsing is disabled.

data.name: Cfg_allowAnonMoDownload_Hdr
data.value: Allow anonymous access to original media file

data.name: Cfg_extractMetadata_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether Gallery Server extracts metadata from files. When enabled, metadata stored in image files such as title, camera model, etc, are extracted when they are uploaded by a user or added through the synchronization process.

Disable this option when metadata does not add value to your gallery, as this will improve performance.

The following formats are supported: EXIF, XMP, tEXt, IFD, and IPTC.

Metadata such as bit rate, duration, and format can also be extracted from video and audio files. This requires that FFmpeg be installed and the application be running at Full Trust.

The FFmpeg utility is included in the free Gallery Server Binary Pack, available for download from the website.

data.name: Cfg_mediaObjectPathIsReadOnly_Bdy
data.value:
Gallery Server helps you share and manage your media collection over the web. In some cases you may not want to allow it to make any changes to your media files. In other words, you want Gallery Server to expose a read-only view of your collection.

When Gallery Server is in read-only mode, users cannot create albums or upload files, nor can they move, copy or delete albums and media assets. That is, they cannot perform any action that modifies the original media files. However, users can synchronize, download, sort, edit titles, captions and tags, and administrators can change settings on the administration pages, including managing users and roles.

There are several requirements that must be met before a gallery can be made read-only:

  • User albums must be disabled
  • The directory for the thumbnail and compressed images must be different than the original media assets directory
  • The option Synchronize directory names with album titles must be disabled

When a gallery is read-only, the only way to add or remove media assets is by manually updating the media assets directory with a tool like File Explorer and then running the synchronize function.

If this setting is enabled, it is recommended to configure the IIS application pool identity to have read-only access to the media assets directory as an additional safeguard. This helps guarantee that the web application cannot manipulate the media files.

data.name: Cfg_optimizedFileNamePrefix_Bdy
data.value:
The string that is prepended to the optimized file name for images. This setting is only used for image media assets where a compressed image file is created.

For example, if an image named puppy.jpg is added, and this setting is zOpt_, the optimized image will be named zOpt_puppy.jpg.

NOTE: Any file named zOpt_puppy.jpg that already exists will be overwritten, so it is important to choose a value that, when prepended to media asset file names, will not conflict with existing media assets.

NOTE: After changing this value, perform a synchronization so that new optimized images are created with the new name and the old ones are deleted.

data.name: Cfg_sendEmailUsingSsl_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether e-mail functionality uses Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) to encrypt the connection. Select this option if your e-mail provider requires SSL.

data.name: Cfg_synchAlbumTitleAndDirectoryName_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether to update the directory name corresponding to an album when the album's title is changed. When true, modifying the title of an album causes the directory name to change to the same value. You may want to disable this if you have a directory structure that you do not want Gallery Server to alter.

Note that even if this setting is disabled, directories will still be moved or copied when the user moves or copies an album. Also, Gallery Server always modifies the directory name when it is necessary to make it unique within a parent directory. For example, this may happen if you give two sibling albums the same title or you move/copy an album into a directory containing another album with the same name.

This setting must be disabled when the gallery is configured to be read-only.

data.name: Cfg_synchAlbumTitleAndDirectoryName_Hdr
data.value: Synchronize directory names with album titles

data.name: Cfg_thumbnailFileNamePrefix_Bdy
data.value:
The string that is prepended to the thumbnail file name for each media asset.

For example, if an image named puppy.jpg is added, and this setting is zThumb_, the thumbnail image will be named zThumb_puppy.jpg.

NOTE: Any file named zThumb_puppy.jpg that already exists will be overwritten, so it is important to choose a value that, when prepended to media asset file names, will not conflict with existing media assets.

NOTE: After changing this value, perform a synchronization so that new thumbnails are created with the new name and the old ones are deleted.

data.name: Cfg_thumbnailImageJpegQuality_Bdy
data.value: The quality level that thumbnail JPG images are created with. Valid values are 1 - 100, with 1 being the worst quality (smallest file size) and 100 being the best quality (largest file size).

data.name: Admin_Albums_EnablePaging_Lbl
data.value: Enable paging when viewing the contents of an album

data.name: Admin_Error_Invalid_PageSize_Msg
data.value: Number of items must be greater than zero.

data.name: Cfg_enableMoDownload_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether Gallery Server lets a user download the file associated with a media asset.

Note that disabling this setting is not 100% effective in preventing a user from downloading a media asset, since a user already has access if he or she can view it in the browser. The only effective method for ensuring users cannot download your media files is to use DRM protection, which is a feature that Gallery Server does not provide.

data.name: Cfg_enableMoDownload_Hdr
data.value: Allow downloading albums and media files

data.name: Cfg_enableMoZipDownload_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether users can download multiple albums and media files. When enabled, users can select multiple thumbnails and download them in a ZIP archive. When disabled, users must download assets one at a time.

data.name: Cfg_enableSlideShow_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether slideshow functionality is enabled. When enabled, a start/pause slideshow button is displayed in the ribbon toolbar.

The length of time each image is shown before automatically moving to the next one is controlled by the slideshow interval setting.

Note that only images are shown during a slideshow; other assets such as videos, audio files, and documents are skipped.

data.name: Cfg_extractMetadataUsingWpf_Bdy
data.value:
When enabled and the application is running in full trust, metadata is extracted from image files using the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) classes available in .NET Framework 3.0 and higher. The WPF classes allow additional metadata to be extracted, such as title, keywords, GPS coordinates, and IPTC data.

Since the WPF classes are only available when running in full trust, this option has no effect in reduced trust installations.

data.name: Cfg_enabledPaging_Bdy
data.value: Indicates whether to limit the number of media assets to display at a time. When paging is enabled and an album has a large number of items, paging controls appear to assist the user in navigating to them. When disabled, all assets are displayed in an album.

data.name: Cfg_pagerLocation_Bdy
data.value: Specifies the location for the pager controls.

data.name: Cfg_sortByMetaName_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies the property and direction by which new albums are sorted.

Choose [Custom] if you want to manually sort items using drag and drop.

Only properties that are visible for albums or media assets on the Metadata Settings page are shown in this list. If necessary, enable the property first on the Metadata page and then run the re-extraction task to create data that can be sorted on. In other words, if you can't see the property in the right pane when viewing the object, you can't sort on it.

Remember that many metadata properties won't be present in a media file - VideoFormat won't exist in images, for example. As a result, enabling and re-extracting a particular property is no guarantee of having data for that item. Media items without any data for the sort property will be grouped together but the sort order among themselves is undefined.

NOTE: To help keep the UI simple, the default album UI template lets users sort by only a few fields. If you want to let users sort by additional fields such as those shown here, edit the album template to include the desired items.

data.name: Cfg_pageSize_Bdy
data.value: Specifies the number of assets to display at a time.

data.name: Validation_Font_Size_Text
data.value: Must be an integer between 6 and 100

data.name: Validation_Int_0_To_10000_Text
data.value: Must be an integer between 0 and 10,000

data.name: Validation_Int_0_To_100_Text
data.value: Must be an integer between 0 and 100

data.name: Validation_Int_10_To_100000_Text
data.value: Must be an integer between 10 and 100,000

data.name: Validation_Int_1_To_100_Text
data.value: Must be an integer between 1 and 100

data.name: Validation_Positive_Double_Text
data.value: Must be a number greater than 0

data.name: Validation_Positive_Int_Include_0_Text
data.value: Must be an integer between 0 and 2147483647

data.name: Validation_Positive_Int_Text
data.value: Must be an integer between 1 and 2147483647

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Default_Roles_Lbl
data.value: Users always belong to these roles:

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_RedirectAfterLogin_Lbl
data.value: Always redirect to user's album after logging on

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_RequireEmailValidation_Lbl
data.value: Require e-mail validation to activate account

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_UseEmailForAccountName_Lbl
data.value: Use e-mail address for user name

data.name: Cfg_enableSelfRegistration_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether anonymous users are allowed to create accounts. If user albums are enabled, an album is created for each user.

data.name: Cfg_enableUserAlbum_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether each user is assigned ownership of an album created solely for that user.

The album is automatically created when the user first logs on and the option 'Automatically create user album the first time a user logs on to the gallery' is enabled. The permissions assigned to the user for this album are copied from the template role _Album Owner Template. You can change the permissions in this role to control the default security access given to each user.

Disabling this option does not delete the user albums.

data.name: Cfg_redirectToUserAlbumAfterLogin_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether to redirect the user to his or her album after logging in. If disabled, the current page is re-loaded or, if there isn't a page, the user is shown the top level album for which the user has view access.

data.name: Cfg_redirectToUserAlbumAfterLogin_Hdr
data.value: Redirect to user album after logging in

data.name: Cfg_requireEmailValidationForSelfRegisteredUser_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether e-mail verification is required when a user registers an account. When selected, the account is initially disabled and an e-mail is sent to the user with a verification link. When the user clicks the link, the user is approved.

If the option to require administrator approval for new accounts is enabled, then the user is not approved until an administrator activates the account.

Enabling this setting reduces spam activity and guarantees that a valid e-mail address is associated with the user.

When disabled, an e-mail address is not required and the user account is immediately created.

data.name: Cfg_useEmailForAccountName_Bdy
data.value: Specifies whether account names are always e-mail addresses. When disabled, the self registration wizard includes fields for both an account name and an e-mail address, but when enabled it requests only an e-mail address.

data.name: Cfg_userAlbumNameTemplate_Bdy
data.value: Specifies the template to use for naming the album that is created for new users. The placeholder string {UserName}, if present, is replaced by the user's account name.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_ShowOwnerRoles_Bdy
data.value:
The album owner and user album features use roles behind the scenes to manage the security access to the albums. These roles are automatically created when needed and always begin with the text Album Owner.

Typically an administrator does not interact with these roles, so they are hidden by default. Check this option to view them.

You may delete an owner role if it is no longer associated with an album or user. If you accidentally delete a role associated with a user album, it will be automatically recreated the next time the user logs on.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_Show_Owner_Roles_Lbl
data.value: Show roles that support the album ownership and user album features

data.name: Admin_Manage_Users_Show_Album_Owner_Roles_Lbl
data.value: Show roles that support the album ownership and user album features

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_RequireAdminApproval_Lbl
data.value: Require administrator approval to activate account

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Show_Album_Owner_Roles_Lbl
data.value: Show roles that support the album ownership and user album features

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Users_To_Notify_For_New_Accounts_Lbl
data.value: Send an e-mail to the following administrators when an account is created:

data.name: Cfg_defaultRolesForUser_Bdy
data.value:
Specify one or more roles that user accounts always belong to. For example, you might want users in a role that provides read-only access to the entire site and/or permission to upload items to a particular album.

Changing this setting immediately updates role membership for all user accounts. If user accounts are created elsewhere (e.g. Active Directory), new users will be added to these roles the first time they log in or when the maintenance routine runs, whichever is first.

You cannot select roles with site administration permission to help reduce the chance of locking yourself and other admins out of the gallery if you later remove the role from this setting.

Note: If user albums are enabled, the user is automatically given full permission to his or her personal album, even if no roles are specified here.

Note: This setting is disabled if you are a gallery administrator and the site administrator has unchecked one or both of the options 'Allow gallery admins to manage users and roles' and 'Allow gallery admins to view users/roles who do not have access to current gallery' on the Site Settings page. It is also disabled if you are using the Active Directory Role Provider (GalleryServer.Web.ActiveDirectoryRoleProvider), since in this case role membership is managed by Active Directory, not this application.

data.name: Cfg_requireApprovalForSelfRegisteredUser_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether an administrator must approve newly created accounts before the user can log on. When enabled, the account is disabled until it is approved by an administrator. (An administrator is a user belonging to a role with AllowAdministerSite permission.)

To receive an e-mail notification when a user creates an account, include your account in the new account notification setting in the User Permissions section. Note that when e-mail verification is enabled, the e-mail notification is not sent until the user validates the e-mail address.

data.name: Cfg_userAlbumParentAlbumId_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies the album in which user albums are created.

If a different album is selected, existing user albums are not automatically moved. To move them to another album, use the standard functionality for moving albums.

data.name: Cfg_usersToNotifyWhenAccountIsCreated_Bdy
data.value:
Specify administrators to receive an e-mail notification when an account is created. This applies to both administrator-created or self-registered accounts.

To receive an e-mail, each user must have a valid e-mail address and e-mail functionality must be configured.

If self-registration is enabled with the e-mail validation option selected, the e-mail is not sent until the new account holder validates the account from the verification e-mail.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Invalid_Role_Name_Msg
data.value: The role {0} does not represent an existing role.

data.name: CreateAccount_Success_Pending_Approval_Detail2_Text
data.value: It is now waiting for administrator approval. If you provided an e-mail address, you will be notified when it is activated.

data.name: CreateAccount_Verification_Comment_Text
data.value: {0} validated {1:MMM dd, yyyy h:mm:ss tt UTC}.

data.name: CreateAccount_Verification_Success_Needs_Admin_Approval_Detail_Text
data.value: Congratulations! Your account has been validated and is now waiting for administrator approval. When it is approved, an e-mail will be sent to you and you will be able to log on.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Invalid_UserAlbumParent_Msg
data.value: Select an album to contain the user albums.

data.name: Admin_Images_DiscardOriginal_Label
data.value: Discard the original image when it is added to the gallery

data.name: Cfg_discardOriginalImageDuringImport_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether to discard the original image when it is added to the gallery. This option, when enabled, helps reduce disk space usage.

This option applies only to images, and only when they are added through an upload or by synchronizing. Changing this setting does not affect existing media assets.

When unchecked, users still have the option to discard the original image on the Add media page by unchecking the corresponding checkbox.

data.name: Admin_MediaObjects_Cannot_Set_MO_Path_Read_Only_Cache_Location_Not_Set

data.comment: <2016.04.20> The error message shown when the user attempts to set the media asset path as read only but the thumbnail and optimized paths are the same as the media asset path.

data.name: Admin_MediaObjects_Cannot_Set_MO_Path_Read_Only_Synch_Title_And_Directory_Enabled
data.value: Invalid configuration. A read-only gallery requires that the automatic renaming of directory names be disabled. Uncheck the option Synchronize directory names with album titles.
data.comment: <2009.05.13> The error message shown when the user attempts to set the media asset path as read only but the option to synchronize album titles and directory names is enabled.

data.name: Admin_MediaObjects_Cannot_Set_MO_Path_Read_Only_User_Albums_Enabled
data.value: Invalid configuration. A read-only gallery requires that user albums be disabled. User albums can be disabled on the User Settings page.
data.comment: <2009.05.13> The error message shown when the user attempts to set the media asset path as read only but user albums are enabled.

data.name: Error_User_Album_Parent_Invalid_Ex_Msg
data.value: User Album Parent Invalid: The gallery '{0}' has an album ID specified ({1}) as the user album container that does not match an existing album. Review this setting in the administration area.

data.name: Task_Delete_Album_Cannot_Delete_Contains_User_Album_Parent_Ex_Msg
data.value: The album {0} cannot be deleted because it contains the user albums. If you want to delete this album, you must first disable the user album feature or configure another album to be the user album container.

data.name: MyAccount_Email_Address_Bdy
data.value: Enter your e-mail address. Certain functions, such as the password recovery feature, require a valid e-mail address.

data.name: MyAccount_EnableUserAlbum_Bdy
data.value:
Enable or disable your own personal album with this option.

When checked, an album is automatically created for your account. Typically this is an album you have administrative rights to, allowing you to upload files, edit existing assets, and delete items. Once created, you can view your album by clicking the link in the top right corner.

If you do not want a personal album, you can delete it by unchecking this option.

WARNING: Disabling your user album causes your album, including all media assets in them, to be permanently deleted! This action cannot be undone.

data.name: MyAccount_EnableUserAlbum_Warning
data.value: Warning: Unchecking this option will delete all items in your album. This action cannot be undone.

data.name: Site_Missing_Data_Text
data.comment: <2009.05.13> The string to use when text is missing. Currently, this is used in place of the logged on user name for the LastModifiedByUserName and CreatedByUserName audit fields in the album class when an object is created/modified by an anonymous user.

data.name: MyAccount_Delete_Account_Confirmation
data.value: When you delete your account, you are immediately logged off and your account is deleted. This action cannot be reversed. Are you sure you want to delete your account?

data.name: MyAccount_Delete_Account_Err_Msg
data.value: An error occurred while deleting this account and has been recorded in the event log (event ID {0}: {1}).
data.comment: <2013.06.01> The message that is shown if an error occurs when the user attempts to delete his or her own account on the my account page. The first placeholder is for the event ID; the second is for the exception type.

data.name: MyAccount_Delete_Account_Overview
data.value: Click the link below to permanently delete your account.

data.name: MyAccount_Delete_Account_Warning
data.value: ATTENTION: This removes all personally identifiable information from the system. This action cannot be reversed.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_AllowCopyingReadOnlyObjects_Label
data.value: Allow a user to copy assets that are read-only

data.name: Cfg_allowCopyingReadOnlyObjects_Bdy
data.value:
Indicates whether to allow the copying of assets a user has only view permissions for. In a community gallery scenario, disabling this option can help prevent users from copying other users' items.

When disabled, a user must be able to write to an album in order to copy assets from it. When enabled, a user can copy assets from any album for which they have view permission.

data.name: Cfg_userAlbumSummaryTemplate_Bdy
data.value: Specifies the template to use for the album caption of a newly created user album.

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_DataProvider_GalleryData_Popup_Bdy
data.value: This gallery data provider stores the gallery data such as titles, captions, metadata, event logs, and configuration settings.

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_DataProvider_Membership_Popup_Bdy
data.value: The membership data provider stores the user accounts.

data.name: Admin_Site_Settings_DataProvider_Role_Popup_Bdy
data.value: The role data provider stores the roles each user belongs to.

data.name: MyAccount_Delete_Account_With_User_Albums_Warning
data.value: ATTENTION: This removes all personally identifiable information from the system, including the contents of your user album. This action cannot be reversed.

data.name: Task_Add_Objects_External_Tab_Invalid_Html_Msg
data.value: The HTML you entered contains text that is not allowed under the current security settings. If you are an administrator, they can be enabled on the User Settings page. Invalid HTML tags: {0}; Invalid HTML attributes: {1}; Invalid JavaScript detected: {2}

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_AllowJavascript_Label
data.value: Allow users to enter JavaScript in titles, captions, and external media assets (not recommended)

data.name: Cfg_allowDeleteOwnAccount_Bdy
data.value:
When enabled, an option is made available on each user's My account page to delete the account. This setting is typically enabled in community gallery scenarios where users are creating their own accounts.

Warning: If user albums are enabled and a user deletes their account, the contents of the user's personal album are also deleted.

data.name: Cfg_allowedHtmlAttributes_Bdy
data.value:
This is a comma separated list of HTML attributes that are accepted as user input when the HTML option is enabled. If an attribute is in this list, a user may include it in titles, captions, and external media asset HTML snippets.

Note that when an attribute is allowed, the value of the attribute is also allowed. The only filtering that takes place on an attribute value is the removal of the string "javascript:" when the JavaScript option is disabled.

data.name: Cfg_allowedHtmlTags_Bdy
data.value:
This is a comma separated list of HTML tags that are accepted as user input when the HTML option is enabled. If a tag is in this list, a user may include it in titles, captions, and external media asset HTML snippets.

For best performance, put the most commonly used HTML tags first.

data.name: Cfg_allowUserEnteredJavascript_Bdy
data.value:
Specifies whether JavaScript is allowed in user input. When enabled, a user may include script HTML blocks and the string "javascript:" in HTML attributes. When disabled, all script HTML blocks and the string "javascript:" is removed from user input.

Note: To use script HTML blocks, you must also enable HTML content and specify the script HTML tag as an allowed tag.

WARNING: It is recommended you leave this option disabled, as turning it on increases the risk of a cross-site scripting attack and other malicious attacks.

There may be times when enabling JavaScript may be useful. For example, some web sites use script tags in their embed code, so the only way to create a media asset with their embed code is to have JavaScript enabled. One option for dealing with this is to temporarily enable JavaScript long enough to configure the media assets with the desired JavaScript. Since disabling this option does not remove existing JavaScript, this technique preserves the JavaScript in those assets while preventing users from adding any new JavaScript.

NOTE: Site and gallery administrators are always allowed to enter any HTML and JavaScript they choose, regardless of this setting.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_AllowManageAccount_Lbl
data.value: Allow a user to manage their account

data.name: Cfg_allowManageOwnAccount_Bdy
data.value:
When enabled, a link to the user's account page appears at the top right of every page. This page allows a user to change their password, update their e-mail address, enter a description, disable their personal user album (if user albums are enabled), and delete their account.

Disable this option to prevent a user from making these changes.

An administrator can always change these settings, even when this setting is disabled, through the Manage Users page.

data.name: Site_No
data.comment: <2009.06.18> See description for the Site_Yes resource.

data.name: Site_Yes
data.comment: <2009.06.18> The word to use that is the equivalent of YES in English. Used for the Yes/No radio buttons on the Edit User dialog of the Manage Users page. May be used in other places in the future.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Delete_Orphan_User_Albums_Confirm_Msg
data.value: You are about to delete the selected albums. This action cannot be undone. Are you sure?

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Orphan_User_Albums_Many_Lbl
data.value: Attention: There are {0} albums in the album {1} that are not assigned to a user. If these albums are orphans and no longer needed, you can delete them.

data.name: Admin_User_Settings_Orphan_User_Albums_One_Lbl
data.value: Attention: There is {0} album in the album {1} that is not assigned to a user. If this album is an orphan and no longer needed, you can delete it.

data.name: Site_Gallery_Text
data.comment: <2010.10.12> The text that is used anywhere we want to use the concept of a gallery.

data.name: Admin_Gallery_Settings_Test_Email_Invalid_Text
data.value: The user '{0}' either does not have an e-mail address associated with the account or it is not a valid e-mail address.

data.name: Admin_General_Invalid_User_Email_Msg
data.value: The user '{0}' does not have a valid e-mail address.

data.name: Admin_MediaObjects_MO_Path_Used_By_Another_Gallery
data.value: Invalid configuration. The path '{0}' is being used by another gallery you do not have permission to administer. Specify a different path.
data.comment: <2010.10.12> The error message shown when a user attempts to specify a media asset, thumbnail, or optimized path that is being used by another gallery, and the user is not a gallery admin for that gallery or a site admin.

data.name: Cfg_enableCache_Bdy
data.value:
When enabled, caching is used to reduce the need to query information from the database, substantially improving performance.

Caching may need to be disabled when this application is deployed on a web farm. The reason is because caching is local to the server, which can result in - for example - a user adding media assets to one server, then being redirected to another server that is not yet aware of the new items, potentially causing an error.

data.name: Admin_VidAudOther_Validation_VideoThumbnailPosition_Text
data.value: Must be an integer between 0 and 86,400

data.name: Cfg_VideoThumbnailPosition_Bdy
data.value:
The position, in seconds, in the video where the thumbnail image is generated from. A value of three indicates the thumbnail for the video is generated from a frame three seconds from the beginning of the video. The value must be between 0 and 86,400 seconds.

If a video is shorter than the value specified here, an image from the beginning of the video is used.

This feature requires the FFmpeg.exe utility be installed in the bin directory and that the application is running in Full Trust. A default thumbnail will be substituted if these requirements are not met or the FFmpeg utility is unable to generate a thumbnail image.

The FFmpeg utility is included in the free Gallery Server Binary Pack, available for download from the website.

data.name: Cfg_MediaContainerDimensions_Bdy
data.value:
These settings specify the default dimensions for video or audio.

For video, when FFmpeg is installed (ffmpeg.exe is in the bin directory), these values are typically ignored in favor of an explicit width and height present in the FFmpeg arguments below, or the actual width and height of the original video if explicit values are not used. For example, if the FFmpeg argument contains '-s 640x480' those values are used for the width and height, not the values specified here.

For audio, these values are assigned to the width and height properties of the media asset.

NOTE: During a synchronization, the width and height of audio media assets are always updated to the values specified here. The width and height of videos, however, are not modified during a sync because they may have already been assigned values we do not want overwritten with these defaults.

data.name: Admin_Manage_Roles_AdminGallery_Bdy
data.value:
This permission provides unrestricted access to one or more galleries. This includes adding and editing albums and media assets and configuring gallery settings. It also includes managing users and roles when the site administrator has enabled this option (Site Settings page).

This permission applies to an entire gallery and cannot be selectively applied to individual albums.
